the depth of water, d metres, in a harbour on a particular day is given by the equation
d = 8 + 5 sin
3
6
πt


             0  t < 24

the harbour is exactly 6 metres.

f (x) = 4x
3 + px
2 + 8x + q
	
where p and q are constants.
	
given that
•	
(2x + 3)  is a factor of f (x)
•	
f (x) has a remainder of –5 when divided by  (x + 2)
	
(a)	 (i)	 show that  p = 10
	
	
(ii)	 find the value of q.
(5)
	
(b)	 hence find the range of values of x for which f (x) is decreasing.
(solutions based entirely on calculator technology are not acceptable.)
(4)

(2)

t

	 giving each answer in simplest form.
